## ShortcutManager.register() method

Register a shortcut key with window.addEventListener("keypress").

The callback will not be affected by conflicting.

**Signature:**

```typescript
register(type: "event", keyOptions: {
        id: string;
        key: string;
        callback: (keyOptions: EventKey) => any;
        modifiers?: string;
        disabled?: boolean;
    }): boolean;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  type | "event" |  |
|  keyOptions | { id: string; key: string; callback: (keyOptions: EventKey) =&gt; any; modifiers?: string; disabled?: boolean; } |  |

**Returns:**

boolean
